metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8105 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: 389 Directory Server before 1.3.2.27 and 1.3.3.x before 1.3.3.9 does not properly restrict access to the "cn=changelog" LDAP sub-tree, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information from the changelog via unspecified vectors.

notes.Note: tyhicks> The Red Hat bug says that FreeIPA versions 4.0+ are affected but it isn't clear to me if it is a bug in freeipa or 389-ds-base sbeattie> further investigation doesn't show any changes made to freeipa for this issue.

criterions.comment: 389-ds-base: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
